title: Vivo V70, V70 Elite to launch in India on 19 February: Expected price, specs and more
snippet: Vivo V70 and V70 Elite will debut in India on 19 February. The V70 Elite will be powered by the Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 processor while the V70 will come running on the Snapdragon 7 Gen 4 processor. Both phones will come with an ultrasonic fingerprint sensor and IP68/IP69 rating.

title: 'Clearly dishonest': Sam Altman slams Anthropic's Super Bowl ad, claims rival only serves 'rich people'
snippet: Anthropic aired ads during the Super Bowl targeting OpenAI, highlighting the introduction of ads in ChatGPT. CEO Sam Altman criticised the ads as deceptive, claiming OpenAI prioritises free access and user agency over monetisation.&nbsp;

title: Next-gen Siri to run on Google servers? Sundar Pichai's deputy confirms 'preferred' partner status with Apple
snippet: Senior Google executives during the company's earnings call stated that Apple had chosen the company as the ‘preferred cloud partner’, suggesting that the next generation of Siri may run on Google's servers instead of Apple's Private Cloud Compute

title: Australia Blasts Big Tech for Child Sexual Abuse Failings
snippet: Australia’s online safety regulator blasted major technology companies including Meta Platforms Inc., Apple Inc. and Google for failing to stamp out child sexual exploitation and abuse on their services, even after repeated calls to address shortfalls.

title: OpenClaw User Says AI Went Rogue, Highlighting Risks of Agents
snippet: Chris Boyd, a software engineer, began tinkering with a digital personal assistant called OpenClaw at the end of January, while he was snowed in at his North Carolina home. He used it to create a daily digest of relevant news stories and send them to his inbox every morning at 5:30 a.m.

snippet: The fiercest competition between the two AI developers, along with bigger companies like Google, is a race to win over corporate leaders looking to adopt AI tools to boost workplace productivity. The rivalry is also spilling into other realms, including the Super Bowl.

title: Amazon projects 50% boost to capital spending this year to $200 billion, shares tumble
snippet: It is the latest sign that Big Tech will not be hitting the brakes any time soon on hefty AI investments. Amazon shares closed down 4.4% during regular trading as worries deepened about the enormous cost of the artificial-intelligence boom.

title: Anthropic unveils new AI model Claude Opus 4.6 as OpenAI rivalry heats up
snippet: Anthropic on Thursday released its latest high-performing artificial intelligence model, escalating its challenge to OpenAI in the intensifying AI race. OpenAI is not taking the challenge lying down, and on Thursday released its own business-focused product, a platform for AI agents called Frontier.

title: Nixi CEO says 400+ banks moved to .bank.in to comply with RBI mandate
